messages.body: Big Techâ€™s Decline Hits a Heavily Owned Stock Sector $GOOG $AAPL $AMZN https://www.wsj.com/articles/big-techs-decline-hits-a-heavily-owned-stock-sector-1522263390

links.title: Big Tech's Decline Hits a Heavily Owned Stock Sector
links.description: Investors piled into hot technology stocks last year and reaped outsized gains. Now the sector's sharp reversal stands to have the opposite effect. High-flying companies including Corp., Inc., and Inc., were among the most widely held last year by institutional equity strategies, such as pension funds and endowments, according to eVestment data.

messages.body: More Pain Could Be Coming for Facebook, Apple, Amazon, Netflix and Google $FB $AAPL $AMZN https://www.smarteranalyst.com/contributor/pain-coming-facebook-fb-apple-aapl-amazon-amzn-netflix-nflx-google-googl

links.title: More Pain Could Be Coming for Facebook (FB), Apple (AAPL), Amazon (AMZN), Netflix (NFLX), and Google (GOOGL)
links.description: It remains to be seen whether the market is in the midst of a garden-variety 10% correction or if this is the start of a deeper bear market. But it does seem like this market is being held aloft buy a small handful of large-cap tech stocks: Facebook (NASDAQ:), Apple (NASDAQ:), Amazon (NASDAQ:), Netflix (NASDAQ:), and Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:) - the infamous FAANGs.

links.title: Markets Right Now: US indexes end choppy day slightly lower
links.description: NEW YORK (AP) - The latest on developments in financial markets (all times local): 4 p.m. Stock indexes ended a choppy day of trading slightly lower as the market struggled to find direction a day after another steep drop. Declines in technology stocks and retailers weighed on the market Wednesday, offsetting gains in health care and other sectors.

links.title: Disappointing Finish to Choppy Session
links.description: BRIEFING.COM] Equities were up and down on Wednesday, eventually settling below Tuesday's closing levels, as influential FAANG names like Amazon (AMZN 1431.42, -65.63) and Netflix (NFLX 285.77, -14.92) dropped sharply for the second day in a row. The tech-heavy Nasdaq declined 0.9%, while the S&P 500 shed 0.3%. The Dow finished flat.
